content: I'm looking for a suggestion of who I can talk to in Montreal about how the Argonaut community is organised and how the project assets are shared. Any suggestions?
Richard, I'd suggest that you talk with Josh Mandel. Also stop by the connect-a-thon DAF track where I expect you'll find several members of the Argonaut implementer community, including myself.
Thanks Dave - Unfortunately I'm not registered for the connectathon but I'm sure I'll see you around.
Richard, in any case, chat with Josh. I will look for you during the week. Also wanted to talk about tooling for logical models.
Hi Richard, what do you mean exactly by "project assets"
Use cases, requirements documentation, meeting notes, governance arrangements , FHIR profiles etc...

Definitely happy to talk in Montreal, @Richard Kavanagh ! The short answer is that Argonaut has a wiki at http://argonautwiki.hl7.org/index.php?title=Main_Page and a github organization with sprints defined at https://github.com/argonautproject/implementation-program/wiki
There are no organized "assets" beyond what's on (or linked to from) those sites.
Thanks @Josh Mandel would definitely be good to chat. I'll find a time next week.
